intro: Hieracium pseudorieni, commonly known as the false hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. Due to its invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
